abstract: Former New York City fireboat John D McKean is now docked in Tarrytown Marina in Westchester County, with its new owners envisioning it as floating museum; 129-foot vessel, which fought fires and rescued people along Hudson River for over half-century, is named after New York Fire Dept marine engineer who died on a city fireboat in 1953 following a steam explosion.
lead_paragraph: After decades of service as a fireboat in the New York Fire Department, the John D. McKean was sold at auction to two restaurateurs who envision a floating museum.

headline.main: A Workhorse on the Hudson River, Now Retired From Fighting Fires, Chugs Toward a Second Act
headline.print_headline: A Workhorse on the Hudson River, Now Retired From Fighting Fires, Chugs Toward a Second Act

snippet: After decades of service as a fireboat in the New York Fire Department, the John D. McKean was sold at auction to two restaurateurs who envision a floating museum.
